title: American_Top_40_1978_October_7th
description:
THIS IS THE LAST THREE HOURS OF A FOUR HOUR BROADCAST. THE FIRST HOUR IS MISSING.

American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This rebroadcast is one of many I have recorded from internet radio. A few are incomplete but most are not and I hope you enjoy these as much as I do.
In this broadcast:

There are two Beatle's remakes in this countdown.

Casey says there have only been four songs in the rock era that have made the top 40 with only numerals for a title (he doesn't know about 1999 yet). One is at number 28, Casey lists the other three.

One artist in the countdown was once described by Newsweek magazine as the greatest live entertainer in rock history.

Another artist in the countdown had 6, million selling albums in the three years prior.

Casey answers the question, "Which American act has had the most number ones in the 70's?"

In the rock era, only two women have been able to put two songs in the top ten at the same time, and they're both in this countdown.

I left the station ID in this recording so, as of this posting, here are some of the best stations to hear future AT40 broadcasts.

All Times Central in the US:

American Top 40 the 70Ã¢â‚¬â„¢s:

94.5 KOOL FM in Phoenix, AZ: starts at 8 am Saturday (plays extras)

970 WGTK in Louisville, KY: starts at 5 pm Saturday

Magic 98 in Madison, WI: starts at 9 pm Saturday (best uninterrupted stream)

American Top 40 the 80Ã¢â‚¬â„¢s:

Magic 98 in Madison, WI: starts at Noon Sunday (best uninterrupted stream)

102.7 Jack FM in Baltimore, MD: starts at 7pm Sunday (plays extras)

Fickle 93.3 in Fairport, NY: starts at 5am Sunday (plays extras but lets the commercials bleed into the show badly)
